itemDescription: British army officer, politician and High Sheriff of Anglesey

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Love Parry Jones-Parry KH (28 November 1781 – 23 January 1853) was a British Army officer, politician and later a High Sheriff. He was the son of Thomas Jones, and after his father acquired an estate at Madryn Park from his cousin Margaret Parry in 1807 took Parry as an additional surname.

response: * Sir Love Jones-Parry, 1st Baronet (1832–1891), Welsh politician
* Love Jones-Parry (British Army officer) (1781–1853), the Baronet's father

*Love Jones-Parry (British Army officer) (1781–1853), Welsh soldier and MP
*Sir Love Jones-Parry, 1st Baronet (1832–1891), Welsh MP, son of the above
*Sir Love Jones-Parry (British Army officer) (1781–1853), British Army lieutenant general
